) Purpose. This IRM section provides instructions for working collection with government agencies, federal employees and retirees, military and and Department of Defense employees. (
) Audience. SB/SE Field Collection employees and group managers. (
) Policy Owner. Director, Collection Policy, SB/SE. (
) Program Owner. Collection Policy - Employment Tax. (
) Primary Stakeholders. Federal, State, Local Governments – Employment (FSL/ET). (

) Program Goals. This IRM provides the fundamental knowledge and proce- dural guidance for collection employees which require interaction with government agencies, federal employees / retirees, military personnel and partment of Defense employees. By following the processes and procedures provided by this IRM, employees will resolve delinquent balances due in a manner that follows IRS policy and procedures while promoting the best interest of the government. ) Information that is directly or indirectly derived from evidence or testimony which an immunized witness was compelled to supply cannot be used that witness in a criminal tax case now or in the future. Caution: To ensure that any criminal tax case against an immunized witness is inadvertently jeopardized, revenue officers must exercise caution they:
Obtain compelled information.
Maintain compelled information in collection case ﬁles. (

) Prepare a memorandum to the Criminal Investigation (CI), Director, Field erations, and forward it through the ﬁeld territory manager. The will state: a. What information is needed, b. Who has the information, and c. Why it is needed for a case. (
) With the advice of Criminal Tax Counsel, the CI Director, Field Operations, respond to the request by: a. Approving, b. Disapproving, or c. Placing limitations on the request. (

) Compelled testimony and other information may not be used in any other action during the pendency of the criminal aspects of the investigation express written consent of the Director, Field Operations. (
) If a prosecution referral to the Department of Justice is in effect, the rence of the Tax Division must be obtained prior to the non-injunctive civil of the testimony or information. (

) Maintain any collection case ﬁle containing compelled information so that: a. The compelled information and any additional information derived is identiﬁable as such. b. All information developed through unrelated, independent also identiﬁable and segregated from the compelled information. c. This compelled information should not be entered into an ICS case history but retained in paper form. (
) Do not give CI personnel access to compelled information without a writing from the CI Director, Field Operations, to the territory manager. (
) Maintain a chronological record of all IRS personnel who had access to compelled information in any open case ﬁle. (
) Revenue officers who have access to compelled information should not be subsequently assigned to any joint criminal investigation on the witness furnished it. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

) State and local governmental entities are generally exempt from federal income tax, but are required to ﬁle employment tax and information return reporting. Unlike federal entities, state and local government segments are subject to enforcement type actions if all resolution attempts have been exhausted. Due to structure of governmental entities, additional research and contact with other areas within the IRS (CAWR, EXAM, FSLG) may be required. If there is a CAWR related discrepancy, contact with CAWR and / SSA may be required to reconcile the account. (

) The postponement under IRC

is in effect while the individual is the United States in the following circumstances: a. Serving in the United States Armed Forces (Armed Forces) or in of the Armed Forces in an area designated as a “combat zone” by the President of the United States (President) in an Executive Order. b.
